tenant_id.description: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.

actions.name: List job binary internals
actions.description:
Lists the available job binary
 internals.

tenant_id.description: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.

name.description:
The name of the job binary
 internal.

actions.name: Create job binary internal
actions.description:
Creates a job binary internal.
 
 Job binary internals are objects that represent data
 processing applications and libraries that are stored in the
 internal database.
 
 
 Specify the file contents (raw data or script text) in the
 request body. Specify the file name in the URI.

tenant_id.description: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.

job_binary_internals_id.description: The ID of the job binary internal.

actions.name: Show job binary internal details
actions.description:
Shows details for a specified
 job binary internal.

actions.name: Delete job binary internal
actions.description:
Deletes a specified job binary
 internal.

tenant_id.description: The unique identifier of the tenant or account.

job_binary_internals_id.description: The ID of the job binary internal.

actions.name: Get job binary internal data
actions.description:
Gets data for a specified job
 binary internal.
 The response body shows the job binary raw data and
 the response headers show the data length.
 Example response:
 HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Length: 161
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Date: Sat, 28 Mar 2015 02:21:13 GMT

A = load '$INPUT' using PigStorage(':') as (fruit: chararray);
B = foreach A generate com.hadoopbook.pig.Trim(fruit);
store B into '$OUTPUT' USING PigStorage();
